articles.author: Krishn Kaushik, Aditya Kalra
articles.description: Millions of dollars were invested in some publicly traded stocks of India's Adani Group via "opaque" Mauritius funds that "obscured" involvement of alleged business partners of the Adani family, the Organised Crime and Corruption Reporting Project (OCCRP) said in an article on Thursday.
articles.title: Adani family's partners used 'opaque' funds to invest in its stocks - media group

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China's manufacturing activity contracted for a fifth straight month in August, but at a slower than expected pace, an official factory survey showed on Thursday, maintaining pressure on Beijing to step up policy support for the stuttering economy.
articles.title: China's factory activity shrinks for 5th month, maintains pressure for policy support

articles.author: Clara Denina, Sarah Mcfarlane
articles.description: Some coal producers are having to set aside tens of millions of dollars to cover their own risks as they are cut adrift by insurers, making it more difficult and costly to do business amid a surge in demand for the fossil fuel.
articles.title: Insight: Coal miners forced to save for a rainy day by insurance snub

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Embattled Chinese property developer Country Garden (2007.HK) faces a critical test of investor confidence on Thursday, with creditors set to vote on its proposal to extend the maturity for an onshore private bond.
articles.title: Country Garden faces key test as onshore bondholders set to vote on extension

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Alphabet's (GOOGL.O) Google said on Wednesday it introduced generative artificial intelligence to its Search tool for users in India and Japan that will show text or visual results to prompts, including summaries.
articles.title: Google introduces generative AI to Search in India, Japan

articles.author: Stella Qiu
articles.description: Asian shares were set for the worst month since February, with sentiment hurt by still-gloomy China factory activity, while investors were also cautious ahead of a barrage of U.S. data that could add to bets that interest rates have peaked.
articles.title: Asian shares set for worst month since Feb on China gloom

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Japan's factory output fell more than expected in July, signalling a rocky start to the second half of the year for manufacturers as worries mount over growth in China and the global economy.
articles.title: Japan's July factory output slumps, raises pressure on manufacturers

articles.author: Soo-Hyang Choi, Josh Smith
articles.description: North Korea conducted a simulated "scorched-earth" nuclear strike on targets across South Korea, state media reported on Thursday, in reaction to allied exercises that it said amounted to plans for a preemptive nuclear attack by the United States.
articles.title: North Korea stages nuclear strike drill to protest allied exercises

articles.author: Edward Mcallister
articles.description: In an ornate chair, surrounded by expensive furniture and artefacts, Gabon's ousted President Ali Bongo pleaded in a video on Wednesday for allies to "make noise" after a military takeover that threatens to end his family's nearly 60 years in power.
articles.title: With Gabon, Africa's coup wave shows little sign of stopping

articles.author: Jonathan Stempel
articles.description: New York's attorney general on Wednesday asked a state judge to declare, even before the start of a trial, that Donald Trump committed fraud by submitting false statements to bankers and insurers and overstating his net worth by up to $2.23 billion.
articles.title: New York says Trump should be found liable for fraud, even before a trial
